div.p: r r r r r r r r r r r r r r r r r ESRF Experiment title: Iron Partial Vibrational Density of States in d-AlNiFe Date of experiment: from: 26 March 2002 to: 30 March 2002

Local contact(s): Dr. Aleksander Chumakov Beamline: ID18 Shifts: 12 Experiment number: HS 1762 Date of report: February 28, 2003 Received at ESRF: Names and affiliations of applicants (* indicates experimentalists): Dr. Richard A. Brand Dipl.Phys. JÃ¼rgen Voss Dr. Aleksander Chumakov Report:

The purpose of this experiment was to measure the iron-partial vibrational density of states g(E) in the decagonal quasicrystal d-AlNiFe using nuclear inelastic scattering (NIS). Parallel inelastic neutron scattering experiments at ILL on isotope-substituted samples have yielded the three different atomic-partial g(E) functions using a new separation algorithm. The purely incoherent iron-partial results of the current experiment were needed to test the reliability of this new method at the very low iron content of this sample (ca. 5 %). In the figure, the different iron-partial and total g(E) results are shown. In the case of our samples, the low iron concentration leads to some difficulties in calculating g Fe (E) accurately from the neutron (INS) results alone. This result shows the importance of the possibility to independently measure the atomic-partial vibrational density of states with this new method. These results, together with other neutron scattering experiments, have now been submitted for publication [1].
[1] R. A. Brand et al., submitted (2003).
